newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL -- Employee Solutions trades higher.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL -- Employee Solutions trades higher.

text.p: Employee Solutions Inc gained 5/8 to 6-7/8 after-hours, after falling 9-1/8 on Nasdaq in extremely heavy trade Friday.

The temporary employee provider lost over 13-1/2 points the last two days and today confirmed market fears that fourth quarter earnings will not live up to Wall Street expectations. The stock was Nasdaq's most heavily traded issue as over 27 million shares changed hands.

Apple Computer was halted for trade after-hours, immediately after announcing it will cut 2,700 jobs and take a $155 million second quarter restructuring charge in an effort to stop its recent profits slide.
"Apple was halted as soon as they announced the restructuring," a trader said. The stock had closed up 3/16 at 16-9/16 on Nasdaq.
Oracle gained another 1/8 after-hours after climbing 4-7/8 to 41 Friday. The database management software maker soared after issuing strong earnings Thursday night.
